title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Frederick S. Tukey to Orlando Brown, March 11, 1867
summary: Tukey responds to a request from the Assistant Commissioner, and provides a list of six whites and six blacks who can possibly serve as community leaders. Tukey comments on the political attitudes and loyalty of the white citizens, and on the literacy and general character of the black citizens he lists.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Church/Religious Activity, Community Values/Local Behavior, Education, Legal System, Patriotism, Politics/Political Attitudes, Race Relations, American Civil War
